definition: good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

sentences.english: If you think he is a good man, think again.
sentences.chinese: 萬一你以爲他是善人，那你就大謬不然了。

sentences.english: The free food was given to a beggar by a benevolent person.
sentences.chinese: 這免費食物是一個善人要給一個乞丐的。

sentences.english: He protests that he is no evil-doer , that God punishes him against his deserts.
sentences.chinese: 他抗議說，他沒有邪惡善人，上帝懲罰他對他的沙漠。

sentences.english: Herdsmen, I say, but they call themselves the good and just.
sentences.chinese: 我說是牧人，可他們自稱爲善人和義士。

sentences.english: It sides only with the good man.
Zhang Fugui had been a good and decent businessman and stability of the county famous.
sentences.chinese: 而張富貴已經成了安定縣城出名的大善人和正經商人。

sentences.english: That thou mayst walk in a good way: and mayst keep the paths of the just.
sentences.chinese: 爲此，你應走善人的道路，持守義人的行徑。

sentences.english: Pardoning the Bad, is injuring the Good.
sentences.chinese: 寬宥惡人，就是傷害善人。

sentences.english: Chau conferred great gifts, and the good were enriched.
sentences.chinese: 周朝大封諸侯，使善人都富貴起來。

sentences.english: Under a harsh prince and bad times , you dare to be good.
sentences.chinese: 在嚴厲的王子和困難世事之下，你要敢於做善人。

sentences.english: The devil is always famous of good heart buried the seeds of temptation.
sentences.chinese: 魔鬼總在名聲顯著的善人心中埋下誘惑的種子。

sentences.english: The eyes of the Lord are everywhere, keeping watch on the wicked and the good.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華的眼目，無處不在，惡人善人，他都鑑察。

definition: to do good works/to be merciful
to accumulate merit/to do good/to give to charity/virtuous actions
people of good will (idiom); charitable person
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
the benevolent man cannot be rich (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
